paragraphs.context: It may heat up due to gaming, charging, or background processes. Close unused apps, avoid heavy usage while charging, and keep your phone updated.

paragraphs.context: Check for battery-draining apps in Settings > Battery. Reduce brightness, turn off background sync, and use Battery Saver when needed.

paragraphs.context: Too many background apps or low storage may cause lag. Clear cache, restart your phone, and update to the latest OxygenOS version.

paragraphs.context: For most models, you can enter Recovery Mode (Power + Volume Down), then select 'Wipe cache partition'. This helps improve performance.

answers.text: For most models, you can enter Recovery Mode (Power + Volume Down), then select 'Wipe cache partition'

paragraphs.context: Go to Settings > System > Reset Options > Erase all data. Make sure to back up important data before resetting.

answers.text: Go to Settings > System > Reset Options > Erase all data

paragraphs.context: Not significantly. OnePlus Warp/SuperVOOC charging is optimized for minimal heat. Long-term use may slightly affect battery health, but it's safe.

answers.text: Warp Charge is OnePlus’s older branding; SuperVOOC is the new shared tech from parent company Oppo

paragraphs.context: OxygenOS is OnePlus’s Android skin known for speed and simplicity. Newer OnePlus phones now run ColorOS in some regions, which has more features but is less minimal.

paragraphs.context: To unify software development with Oppo and reduce maintenance costs. This move helps faster updates but sacrifices the old clean OxygenOS feel.

answers.text: To unify software development with Oppo and reduce maintenance costs
